entry.content:
Identity Reflection

A workshop to find the Team's current and future identity.

First step participants build individually the team's identity and each of them shares his/her vision with the built model.

Then they build the shared Teams identity by using part of each individual model. During this step participants build the current identity of the team and get aligned with the composed model.

Next step is to build the future or aspirational identity: we start again with individual buildings: each participant builds the aspirational identity of the team. Once each of them has shared his/her point of view is the moment to build a shared aspirational identity of the team. Who do we want to be in 3 years? What defines our aspirations?

Finally with the 2 shared models (current and aspirational identity) they reflec on what do they need to move from the current identity to the future vision.

Benefits:

  • Reflection about the team and what's the role of each participant within it
  • Understand other points of view
  • Improve communication and team's cohesion
  • Become conscious of team values
  • Creation of social bonds through the game
  • Establish agreement point to improve the team
  • Clear next steps and action plan.
  

 

 

 

Living the Mission

 

This company had already the misssion defined and they choosed the LEGO® Serious Play® tool to cascade it through their teams and reflect on it.

We started asking participants to build a model about what was the meaning of the mission for each of them.

Then they shared each model and the next step was to place the models in a landscape and tell a story that included all the models.

Other models build made them reflect on:

What would be the impacts that, the realization of the Vision, would bring to the Company?

How this would change the way they work together?

What effects would this misssion bring to their customers?

Benefits:

  • High engagement and commitment with the mission
  • A great sense of belonging
  • Agreement with the core company values
  • Team cohesion and better communication

entry.content:
What LEGO® Serious Play® is?

LEGO® Serious Play® methodology is a facilitated thinking, communication and problem – solving technique for use with organizations, teams and idividuals.
The tool is meant for organizational development and transformation and designed to develop the skills that allow innovation and improve performance. 

LEGO® Serious Play® Enables

  • Enjoying at work and increasing team cohesion
  • A trust and confidence climate creation.
  • Quick access to real problems.
  • The most effective communications.
  • Exploring new possibilities.
  • Information-based decision making.
  • The joint construction and alignment of people with the vision and mission of the organization.
  • Participants’ commitment to their work, their team, the projects and the goals of the organization.

It is an, experiential process designed to enhance innovation and business performance. It taps into a team’s creativity, enabling them to create robust solutions for organizational challenges.

It combines different learning styles such as visual, auditory, and kinesthetic in a unique, creative, and powerful way. It encourages participants to think differently and get emotionally engaged.

It is the ideal tool to develop creative and innovative thinking with 100% participation, all of that in an atmosphere that propels new ideas generation.  

  

 

 

How does it work?

 

We use LEGO® bricks to build meaningful abstract models that are then used to reflect and discover new ideas.
The process helps participants to think differently and become emotionally engaged.

Process:

  • We start together with the client stablishing the strategic objectives and the scope that drives the workshop development and outcome. 
  • Participants build and share meaningful models through metaphors in a variety of work dynamics.
  • Participants work on the construction of the identity of a person, team, product, problem ,etc.
  • Collectively, participants build scenarios that reflect the complexity of the problem/situation.
  • Simulations on the built environment are performed
  • Finally, we analyze the basic principles that guide our actions and decisions.

 

 

 

What is it for?

 

  • Quickly find the answers that the organization requires to achieve its objectives. 
  • Define, represent, share and agree on the vision of each participant on the problem to be solved through a specific model.
  • Acknowledge and agree on commonalities.
  • Propose different solutions and represent them in an understandable and concrete way.
  • The model with the conclusions is built using a scenario that simulates reality which provides a real experience of the impact that its conclusions represents. It is built using a scenario that simulates reality, allowing a concrete and clear image that can be photographed, filmed, or preserved as a model, which facilitates its future analysis and re-elaboration.

Enabling teams’ collaboration

Co-Active certified coach (CTI) and Organization and Relationships System coaching (ORSC), Imma has a solid experience in training and coaching. 
Imma is a transformation and growth catalyst who helps individuals and teams to expand their limits and reach the best version of themselves.
Passionate for training and coaching, she devotes her enthusiasm and commitment to personal and professional development of people and teams.
More than 30 years experience in the healthcare industry give Imma the knowledge and experience to inspire individuals and teams to change.

She is a biologist, mum, entrepreneur and cooking amateur.

 

Anna Donato 

 

Anna is passionate for team and personal development. That is why in her work, she combines coaching tools, team coaching approaches and change management to help teams grow and evolve.

She is specialized in LEGO Serious Play and has a background in marketing and brand communications at the LEGO Group.

Her approach is always creative, interactive and self-reflective.

Anna is a lifelong-learner, a sports enthusiast, a book nerd and loves to discover the world.

 

Carmen Beltrán Hidalgo 

 

Carmen has more than 25 years of professional experience in a multinational company in the food and beverage industry and in Human Resources Management; with a focus on talent development projects for leaders and their teams.

This solid experience allows her to accompany executives to grow personally and professionally in their leadership, emotional intelligence and soft skills, through training, mentoring and coaching.

She is a Certified Co-active Coach by CTI and Team Coach by CIVSEM (Center for Research in Values) and Mentor of leaders.

Her vocation is to accompany people, teams and organizations to make the transformations they want and need, so that they meet their life goals from trust and balance.

She is also a mother, cooking relaxes her and she reads everything she can get her hands on.

Executive coaching

Our coaching is based on the Co-Active (CTI) model:

Coaching is an experience that provides awareness and drives change for the best, so coachees can reach their full potential.

 At we purpose we create the right space to make change happen for individuals and teams, we use a variety of training and coaching tools to give them the best experience.

We believe that everyone is naturally complete, creative and resourceful and we work with the person as a whole, focusing on his/her integral growth.

We help individuals to align with values and life purpose, becoming conscious of what makes this alignment happen.

We go along with each coachee to achieve a fulfilled life through conscious decisions and to achieve their individual and business goals.

We believe that this model allows coaches to sustainably integrate all the learning and use it effectively to impact the organization.

 

Team's coaching

None is an island, we’re all part of complex systems. A system is composed of many parts, yet the sum is greater than those parts.

Any issue in one individual impact the rest of the system, so working with the entire team we generate more impact than working with individuals.

We provide a vivid and practice experience. Using ORSC (Organization & Relationship Systems Coaching) tools to make the team become conscious and intentional in their relationships.

Team coaching creates a positive impact on the team itself and the entire organization.

A successful organization is composed of successful teams. We focus on the team’s potential empowering all team members, turning the entire group in a high-performance team
